FacilityName: Noah's Ark Processors LLC dba WR RESERVE

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY





It is the policy of WR Reserve to conduct business in a manner that is safe to the employees, the community, and the environment. The Company's managers and supervisors are accountable to carry out the policies of the Company relevant to the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous materials. WR Reserve has made a determined effort to develop a plan to prevent releases of extremely hazardous substances. Procedures to assist in the prevention of extremely hazardous material releases are set forth in EPA's Risk Management Program. In the event of a release, the Emergency Response Plan will be the guidance for responding to, containing, and reporting such releases.  The company will coordinate with public responders and emergency services in ensuring safety of the public.







FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES



WR Reserve is a beef processing facility, that begins with a slaughtering process all the way through packaging.   To prevent contamination with harmful bacteria and to cool the final product, ammonia is used. Ammonia is used as a refrigerant to maintain cooler temperatures in the various stages of the process. The refrigeration system is a closed loop system, meaning the ammonia is continually reused.







RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



Anhydrous ammonia is the only regulated substance present at the site. The company is aggressively developing programs, policies, and materials requirements to minimize the possibility of releases. These programs include compliance with appropriate OSHA and EPA regulations and sound safety practices.  Training for employees will be conducted to maintain a high level awareness when working with hazardous materials.





As part of the Prevention Program, WR Reserve will develop a method to evaluate the Risk Management Program. This method will include periodic evaluations of the Program utilizing a Process Hazard Analysis and Compliance Au

dits. 







FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



WR Reserve has not had an accidental release as defined in 40 CFR 68.42(a) during the last five years. 







EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN



Drills are conducted annually for on-site responses.





SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS



Future changes to improve release prevention include: improved maintenance procedures, hiring qualified contractors, annual reviews of current program, following management of change procedures to ensure hazards are addressed with each change, addition of new technology as it becomes available; and continued training of plant personnel.
